body.name: ASUS H770 ATX Motherboard with PCIe 5.0, ThunderboltTM Support
body.merchantInfo: Sold by Amazon Warehouse and Fulfilled by Amazon. Ships from and sold by InfinityProduct.
features: Intel LGA 1700 Socket: Ready for 13th and 12th Gen Intel processors
Ultrafast Connectivity: PCIe 5.0, three PCIe 4.0 M.2, Realtek 2.5Gb Ethernet, USB 3.2 Gen 2 Type-C and Thunderbolt (USB4) header support
Comprehensive Cooling: VRM heatsink, M.2 heatsink, PCH heatsink, hybrid fan headers and Fan Xpert 2plus
ASUS OptiMem: Careful routing of traces and vias to preserve signal integrity for improved memory stability
Aura Sync RGB Lighting: Onboard Addressable Gen 2 headers and Aura RGB headers for RGB LED strips, easily synced with Aura Sync-capable hardware
body.description: ASUS Prime H770-PLUS D4 motherboard is expertly engineered to unleash the full potential of 13th & 12th Generation Intel® processors, featuring PCIe 5.0, DDR4, 2.5Gb Ethernet, USB 3.2 Gen 2 Type-C®, and Thunderbolt™ (USB4®) support. Boasting a robust power design, comprehensive cooling solutions and intelligent tuning options, Prime H770-PLUS D4 provides PC DIY builders a range of performance tuning options via intuitive software and firmware features.

productInformation.name: Customer Reviews
productInformation.value: 4.4 4.4 out of 5 stars 46 ratings 4.4 out of 5 stars

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Solid so far
reviews.reviewText: Been up/ running since Dec '23. Using NVMe, HDMI, all USB, lan...etc pretty much all ports/ output utilized. So far so good 👍🏽

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good motherboard and it's Windows 11 compatible
reviews.reviewText: Got this motherboard to replace an older 3rd generation motherboard in a computer I use for music recording. Didn't realize at the time that it was Windows 11 compatible so I was able to upgrade from Windows 10. Works well so far. IMHO, Asus makes the best motherboards.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Almost perfect board
reviews.reviewText: I love it.Multiple Sata PortsMultiple M.2 SlotsExpansion support for added featureslots of case fan headers.Supports for RGB.list goes on.. except,The IO Shield is awful.I spent 25 minutes bending the little sharp edges so my motherboard can lay flush with my case and against the IO. Usually they’re padded but for some reason, this isn’t.Other than that, perfecto.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 9, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Love this motherboard & 12th gen i7 I bought along with it.
reviews.reviewText: My aging game system that I built over 20 years ago was brutally slow. I don't use the PC for gaming and have not for over a decade, having switched to a Playstation 3 on my son-in-law's recommendation just after I built the PC. I've upgraded to a PS4 then PS5 over the years since. But I've used the PC as a programming workstation, SQL Server & webserver for years. Earlier this year I decided to do a motherboard / cpu / memory upgrade on the PC, basically starting from scratch. I'd already upgraded the case, power supply & memory over the years but the tech on my motherboard and cpu was old - really old. This motherboard, a 12th gen i7 & 16 gigs of new memory and everything is much more responsive. Zero log jams on either server running on the same machine. The install for this motherboard was the simplest build I've ever done. Everything basically snapped together & was up and running without any further hassle than a simple bios upgrade. I installed it 4 months ago and could not be happier.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Nice features, Wish I had time to put all new systems together.
reviews.reviewText: Decent board, should be a screamer when it goes together. As usual Amazon will help.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 14, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Pretty basicotherboard, can't complain, just rebuilt my girlfriend's PC with it and everything went smoothly. Would purchase again.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Nice motherboard. Easy to set up.
reviews.reviewText: Just put together a new build using this ASUS Prime H770-Plus D4 motherboard with an Intel 13th gen CPU. Downloaded all the drivers, BIOS updates, etc from ASUS website. Updated the BIOS, installed hardware, drivers, and Windows 10 Pro x64. No problems whatsoever. I'm happy with it and pleased with various features.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Works pretty good but hard to configure by even an expert
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. Works pretty good but hard to configure by even an expert. Read the manual on this one . The PCIe 5 slot will not work unless properly enabled on the bios . PCIe 4 storage interface must be configured as well. Neither I or a a local tech where able to build an array as the disks kept disconnecting and disappearing . Once configure as individual disks the system works well runs rather hot and very resent passmark scores in all but memory . Top 70% to 92% based in component . 90 percentile over all. I like it better than MSI boards I tested . This is my top high end pc build
great mobo when on sale, features seem to be all there minus the z platform.

Bought it and said there was suppose to come with sata cables, I/o shield, rubber package and screw package. I installed the motherboard itself but missing all of the parts listed above it was supposed to come with. I would loved it if I could get those parts. I paid Alot of money and don't even get all the stuff it was said to come with. Over all good motherboard not so good in including all the parts.
